required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: UB-421 Combine With Optimized Background Therapy Regimen in Multi-Drug Resistant HIV-1 Infection Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Single-Arm, 24-Week Study of UB-421 in Combination With Optimized Background Therapy (OBT) Regimen in Patients With Multi-Drug Resistant (MDR) HIV-1 Infection

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 2, multi-center study, designed to evaluate the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of UB-421 in conjunction with a failing existing ART regimen for 1 week and optimized background therapy (OBT) for 24 weeks, respectively.

primary_outcome.measure: Effectiveness by Viral Load Log10 Change from Baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-related adverse events

intervention.description: The prescribed OBT must contain at least one agent to which the participant's virus is known to be fully sensitive.
